website_summaries.verdict: Give the bad guys their own Dieselnaut super tank with this 1,179-piece building set.
pros: This massive tank is over 19” long once assembled with 2 rotating turrets, a crane, spring-loaded weapons, a minifigure cockpit, and a hidden compartment where the sneaky bad guys can hide extra weapons
cons: Occasionally there might be a piece missing from one of the bags
Those missing pieces are difficult to replace

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loved it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for Christmas for 13 year old grandson who loves lego building. He enjoyed it very much.
customer_reviews.author: CPL

customer_reviews.title: Awesome set!
customer_reviews.text: This set is a blast to build and is great for display or play. If you have one of the Ninjago dragons then there's a ton of play value, but you don't get much in the box besides the Dieselnaut itself, so I reccomend picking up a companion piece.
customer_reviews.author: ThePhoenixKing

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun for my grandson
customer_reviews.text: Very interesting and engaging for my grandson. He's enjoying it and keeps on thanking me for it.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice W D'sa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lego!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for christmas and he loved it. It's a really beautiful and cool lego set which he put together leisurely in a few days. Looks great!
customer_reviews.author: JungleBaby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Ninjago fans!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old is in LOVE with this set! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly G.

customer_reviews.title: Lego brand speaks for itself!
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent sized set, average cost for Legos. It took a 12 year old a morning to assemble and be playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Big Horn 09

customer_reviews.title: Great for Ninjago fans.
customer_reviews.text: My child is obsessed with Legos... especially sets like this one. He had it completely assembled with zero help within a couple of hours. There is nothing to dislike about this set.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Momma

customer_reviews.title: Goodgiftforgrandson
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for the grandson. He loves it! $5 of plastic marketed for $110. You gotta love America!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bach

customer_reviews.title: Used and repackaged!
customer_reviews.text: The product came repackaged and used! Pieces were missing and I was under the impression this product was new! Now I don’t have a birthday gift for my son!
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old son is in heaven over this set. Great set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great set with lots of Ninjago minifigures for imaginative play
customer_reviews.text: Built this with my 9 year old and we really enjoyed it. It is a large set and may be difficult for younger children to put together. We've had many a great time, re-enacting epic battles with this. In terms of pros and cons, Pros: 1. Includes 7 minifigs 2. The fort/weapons stand is a nice touch 3. The cage feature pops out the back Cons: 1. Tracks don't rotate very well. 2. Large number of pieces; complex to put together. 3. Pieces along the sides tend to fall off with crashes (although that is to be expected!)
customer_reviews.author: RealDave

customer_reviews.title: A BEAST
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast to construct and my Lego wiz-kid son was probably a little intimidated by it for a long time because he just stared at the unopened box. The construction of the toy is definitely a job in itself, so that is definitely a selling point. I'm not a big fan of the high prices on lego toys and this one is no exception. Had I had to pay full price for this, I probably would have used the $100 to be more practical and spread out the wealth a little bit. That being said, my son loved it and the fact that so many of the characters were included.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Kennison

customer_reviews.title: Super fun and HUGE.
customer_reviews.text: This is a crazy toy. It comes with a bunch of mini-figs, and is the coolest giant Lego tank my 7 year old could have imagined. It's like all those crazy tank designs I drew when I was a kid, but out of Lego. It was super fun, if a bit complicated to build, it has lots of cool features, and it rolls around tank-like. This is a great toy for boy or girl who likes tanks, ninjas, lego, or any / all of the above.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Great 1,000+ piece set
customer_reviews.text: This is a seriously detailed set that is better for older kids and adults who like to build collector Lego sets for display. The Dieselnaut battle tank has 1,179 pieces and includes 7 Lego people: The tank is really cool with rotating turrets with spring-loaded shooters. These types of features are not standard on smaller Lego sets. So it is an added plus for the kids after they put it together. I really don't have any complains with this. After building it, we put it on the shelf in the game room with other collector edition Lego sets.
customer_reviews.author: Mathlete

customer_reviews.title: A fun build
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I are big Lego fans, and she loves Ninjago, so this was a natural addition to her collection of Lego Ninjago sets. It's not as impressive as the Destiny's Bounty set (for my money the coolest Ninjago one), but it's a fun build, and the finished product is a lot of fun. There are a number of fun little details that make this a more intricate set than it looks like (the retractable anchor on the side, for example), and the minifigs that come with it are great. All in all, we had a fun time building it, and the finished product looks very cool in a steampunk kind of way.
customer_reviews.author: Matthieu P. Raillard

customer_reviews.title: Playable kit for children
customer_reviews.text: I love LEGO but Ninjago isn’t my favorite series. I’m an adult and tend to like the kits that amaze with what they can create using basic blocks. The Ninjago have more specialty pieces and parts that move. They are great for kids who get something cool looking and playable after the build.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Ginsburg

customer_reviews.title: Takes awhile but a lot of creative play options - worth the high cost
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I cringe at Lego prices, but then I realize that is what my kids play with 80% of the time and they last forever, I realize the deals are better than most toys. This set is very hard to put together. We are talking hours if the kid(s) do it on their own, which they should. I think any mature kid over 7 (but closer to 8) could handle this. The big winner is Ninjago is fun and the creative play is there for kids to play for hours. Having a lot of characters helps too. Even my oldest (16) who watched the original tv series was into it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: King of Awesomist Awesome Times Infinity
customer_reviews.text: Wow this battle machine is over-the-top. Claw teeth on the front grille, tank treads plus off road tires, chains, missiles (that actually shoot), swords, bow & arrow. Even a toddler left home alone with a Sharpie pen is no match for the destruction ability of this machine. With 1179 pieces it took just over a week to build (casually a little bit each evening). Here are some photos of the instruction manual for an idea of how the structure evolves during the construction. This is a wicked Lego creation! Toddler LOVES it!
customer_reviews.author: D. Coral

customer_reviews.title: Massive Set!
customer_reviews.text: This is perhaps the largest set I've ever put together! The vehicle is huge and took about an hour and a half for my 12 year old son (primarily) to put together. The mini figures are cool, but we have a ton of Ninjago figures. It was the massive vehicle that makes this set. Once done, it is incredibly impressive! My son and I love this Lego set and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: AshertopiA

customer_reviews.title: Fun to build and play with
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lego set. The price per piece isn't stellar, but it has several specialized pieces and a lot of minifigures. The play value of this set is very high with little compartments, a ram on the front, and generally a really cool looking set. Both my 4 YO and 13 YO like it a lot, and the older has it locked away to make sure it stays intact. Highly recommend this lego set.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T

customer_reviews.title: Wow wow!!! Fun
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! What a complex collection. This is huge!! Big box with tons (well not tons, but lots ) of pieces. Perfect for gifting. They will spend long hours of entertainment building this set. A bit pricey, but complete. Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Roxana

customer_reviews.title: Another great Lego set
customer_reviews.text: Great fun to build, display and play with. Typically high Lego quality. How do they keep coming up with more and more interesting characters and structures?
customer_reviews.author: John T. Horner

customer_reviews.title: Wow, love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our family loves Legos and this set with over 1,000 pieces certainly got us excited. It was fun to build, even if it took some time. We enjoyed every minute it. Love that we have seven mini figures and it so detailed and amazing. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: grumpydan

customer_reviews.title: Ninjago Legos
customer_reviews.text: My 11 and 9 year old boys absolutely LOVE this set. They love Legos. They love Ninjago. So, of course, this set it perfect for them. It is a larger set and took them a little over an hour to complete.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Jane

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic design, with a great price for well over 1000 pieces - plus 7 minifigures! This will definitely impress your lego/ninjago lovers when they open it as a gift!
customer_reviews.author: Oliver DeMille, TJEd

customer_reviews.title: 9-14 age requirement
customer_reviews.text: I like that it contains over a thousand pieces of Lego. But it is challenging to build and more so to play with. Getting seven minifigs is also very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Reverend Skull

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best Lego set ever the value of money is a little too expensive I think it should be $50 instead of $86
customer_reviews.author: Anne STewart

customer_reviews.title: It take a while to build
customer_reviews.text: It's worth your money it was very stir try and many playing fetuses great for your kids
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: LEGO NINJAGO Masters of Spinjitzu: Dieselnaut 70654 Ninja Warrior Toy and Playset, Fun Building Kit with Brick Battle Tank Vehicle (1179 Pieces)
product_meta.description: Team up with Ninja warriors teen Wu, Jay and Zane to confront the LEGO Ninjago 70654 dieselnaut tank, featuring rotating turrets with spring-loaded shooters, an opening minifigure cockpit, minifigure platform with fully opening roof, crane function, jail and hidden weapon rack. This set also includes a statue with all 4 of the collectible Dragon armor elements, plus 7 LEGO Ninjago minifigures with assorted weapons.
feature_bullets: Inspire your ninja warrior builders with the perfect gift: the awesome armored Diselnaut battle tank with rotating turrets, spring-loaded shooters, and tons of ninja minifigures to battle the Dragon Hunters. Boys and girls will love this ninja tank playset!

The Dieselnaut battle tank is built with 1,179 pieces and includes 7 minifigures: Teen Wu, Jay, Zane, Iron Baron, Heavy Metal, Muzzle and Skullbreaker. Tank features rotating turrets with spring-loaded shooters and a crane function.

The Dragon Hunters’ Dieselnaut tank features an opening minifigure cockpit, opening roof, 2 rotating turrets with spring-loaded shooters, plus a hidden rear compartment for ninja weapons. Roleplay awesome ninja battle scenes!

LEGO NINJAGO Masters of Spinjitzu: Dieselnaut building kit is compatible with all LEGO construction sets for creative building. Ninja playset for boys and girls aged between 9 and 14 and for fans and big kids of all ages

The bad guys' Dieselnaut battle vehicle measures over 7” (18cm) high, 19” (49cm) long and 9” (23cm) wide. The best toy for ninja role-play and recreating epic ninja scenes from the NINJAGO Masters of Spinjitzu TV show

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars142 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
